alert.note: Alert for Midland; Saginaw (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 01 at 5:16PM EDT until April 03 at 11:26AM EDT by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Detroit/Pontiac MI has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Michigan... Tittabawassee River At Midland affecting Midland and Saginaw Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT TO LATE MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Tittabawassee River At Midland. * WHEN...From late tonight to late Monday morning. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:45 PM EDT Saturday the stage was 20.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late tonight to a crest of 25.0 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage early Monday morning. - Flood stage is 24.0 feet. - Impact...Between 24.5 and 25 feet, St Charles Drive floods and West St Andrews begins to flood at Snake Creek. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown.
